JUDGES: Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Mykhaylo Buromenskiy;Peer Lorenzen;Renate Jaeger;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in the town of ORG , GPE .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant had an accident . Later he was registered disabled .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant instituted proceedings against ORG of ORG , ORG , ORG and ORG in the NORP ORG of ORG claiming compensation for the damage caused to him as a result of the accident . The applicants also sought the rectification of his work records .
CARDINAL . On DATE the case was transmitted to the Pridneprovsky ORG ( “ the first - instance court ” ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the first - instance court partly allowed the applicant ’s claims . On DATE it gave an additional judgment by which the remainder of his claims were left without consideration .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of Appeal quashed the judgment of DATE and the additional judgment of CARDINAL DATE and remitted the case to the first - instance court for fresh consideration .
CARDINAL . On DATE the first - instance court found against the applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG upheld that judgment .

CARDINAL . NORP The applicant lodged an appeal in cassation with ORG against the judgment of DATE and the ruling of DATE . According to the applicant ’s submissions , he also challenged a number of the procedural decisions taken by the lower courts before ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal in cassation .

CARDINAL . In respect of the applicant ’s appeals in cassation against the procedural decisions , ORG informed him that they were not subject to appeal according to the provisions of LAW . However , the applicant tried to institute administrative proceedings against ORG , claiming that the latter had taken no action to consider his appeals in cassation . His efforts were to no avail .

CARDINAL . The applicant ’s subsequent requests to have the judgment of DATE and the rulings of DATE and DATE reviewed under the extraordinary review procedure were rejected by the domestic courts as unsubstantiated .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant lodged a complaint against ORG for refusing to employ him . On DATE the Sosnivsky ORG of ORG found against the applicant . On DATE ORG upheld that judgment . On DATE ORG upheld the decisions of the lower courts . Later , the applicant tried to institute criminal proceedings against the judge of the Sosnivsky ORG of Cherkassy who had considered his case , alleging that he had forged the court records and destroyed important documents . His efforts were to no avail .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant instituted proceedings against the Head of ORG of ORG , Mr NORP , in the NORP ORG of Cherkassy , challenging his actions . On DATE the court partly allowed his claims . On DATE ORG upheld that judgment .

CARDINAL . In DATE and DATE the applicant instituted a number of administrative proceedings in the first - instance court complaining about actions of the judges at the first - instance court and ORG taken in their official capacity while considering his claims . These claims were rejected by the first - instance court . The applicant failed to provide detailed information about any appeals lodged with the higher courts against the rulings to reject his claims .
